executive_summary: Tom Hayes is extremely bullish on Emerging Markets and China, particularly Alibaba. He believes the market is misinterpreting Trump's policies and that a weaker dollar will drive Emerging Markets higher. He is also very bullish on Boeing, Cooper Standard, Advanced Auto Parts and Etsy as turnaround plays. He sees a potential rotation out of the Magnificent 7 into undervalued sectors. He emphasizes the importance of buying quality businesses below intrinsic value and remaining patient.

key_reasons: Trump's pledge for easier regulatory backdrop

macro_thesis_summary: Hayes believes that the market is misinterpreting Trump's policies, particularly regarding China. He anticipates a weaker dollar, benefiting Emerging Markets. He also highlights the global easing cycle and favorable demographics as tailwinds for the market. He expects a pullback after the inauguration, which will present buying opportunities.

key_macro_data_points.value: Soared to a three-year high after Trump win
key_macro_data_points.tom_interpretation: History doesn't repeat, but it rhymes. This is similar to what happened after the 2016 election.

key_macro_data_points.value: China has a lot of room to raise the fiscal deficit
key_macro_data_points.tom_interpretation: While the US is reigning in spending, China is raising its fiscal deficit, raising fiscal stimulus, and raising growth.

key_macro_data_points.indicator: Asset Managers Bearish on the Dollar
key_macro_data_points.value: Asset managers are the least bearish on the dollar since 2017
key_macro_data_points.tom_interpretation: This is a contrarian indicator. The dollar is likely to weaken, benefiting Emerging Markets.
The backdrop for stock pickers is the best in 25 years.

key_macro_data_points.value: Lagging the percentage of central banks easing

key_macro_data_points.tom_interpretation: Says economy stable, companies more optimistic about 2025, but tariffs a worry.
Number one key indicator of future volumes is incentives.

BA.thesis_summary: Boeing is a turnaround story with a new CEO, Kelly Ortberg, a solved union issue, and a massive backlog. The demand for flying is increasing, and China will double its fleet by 2043. Boeing is one of only two vendors, giving it duopolistic pricing power.
key_metrics: New CEO Kelly Ortberg's track record

CRI.thesis_summary: Cooper Standard is a turnaround play in the auto industry, making rubber seals for windows and doors. The company has taken costs out of the business and is poised to benefit from increased auto production. Solvency risk has been removed, and the company is now at break-even.

AAP.thesis_summary: Advanced Auto Parts is the worst-performing auto retailer with a new CEO, Shane O'Kelly, who has a track record of success. He has taken solvency risk off the table by selling the Canadian business and closing underperforming stores. The company expects to increase operating margins by 500 basis points.

ETSY.thesis_summary: Etsy is a turnaround story with a niche platform for customized and bespoke products. The stock is down 80% from its highs, but free cash flow generation is still strong. The company is implementing initiatives to re-accelerate growth and clean up the curation of the website.

risks_and_contrarian_flags: Potential for a pullback after the inauguration
Risk of Japanese bond yields rising and unwinding the carry trade
technical_takeaways: Emerging Markets are breaking out and retesting, indicating a potential violent upward move. The Hang Seng Index is showing an uptrend with higher highs and higher lows. The 10-year yield is rolling over. The dollar is showing a fake out above resistance and now rolling back over.
